bio: Helping Latin American artists launch their NFTs with fun on-chain raffles ðŸŽ°
contributionDescription:
We organize fully on-chain Optimism raffles with online and offline participants. We also take time to onboard newcomers to the event.

We provide latam artists with comprehensive support throughout their journey, from onboarding and NFT creation to raffling their NFTs in our Randomness Ceremony and monetizing their work.

In addition, we airdrop ETH tokens to newcomer participants and artists so they can purchase tickets to get in our events and cover gas expenses.

We also develop the smart contracts, website, and randomness generation mechanisms that underpin our raffles.

contributionLinks.description: Lotto and NFT Ceremony on OP Mainnet

impactDescription:
Latam artists are guided and submit their NFTs to be featured and won by degens eager to acquire art and token prizes.

Our website is becoming increasingly user-friendly, providing a positive experience for all visitors.

We are confident that our efforts are not merely onboarding participants to Optimism, but also forging associations between the platform and enjoyable community experiences.

Also all our code is open source and uploaded to github.

By inviting the friends we've made all around the world I believe we are building trust and community.

impactMetrics.description: Event counter in the new contract

pwCategorySuggestions: Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), Community Building, Smart Contract Platforms
pwRecategorizeReason: NO, it is not correctly categorized. Despite being marked as a 'PROJECT', the application talks about "I" indicating it should be categorized as an 'INDIVIDUAL'.
